title: Canon Hub
content:
[[div class="canon-block opener"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/about-the-scp-foundation/scp-logo-signature.png]]

The idea that there is no canon is a bit silly at times. It's not that we don't have any — It's that we have a multitude which touch, cross, and dip into each other. It's up to you, as the reader, to decide what you believe and what you embrace as the heart of the universe.

That doesn't mean, though, that authors lack intent or design, and collaboration is the heart of innovation.
[[/div]]

[[div class="info-wrapper"]]
[[div class="info"]]
Collected below are links to the recognized, shared canons of the SCP Foundation Universe. To write in one, you should make sure that you read the other material from that canon and try to remember that these things are connected.

If you're interested in forming your own canon, read the information at the bottom of the page.
[[/div]]
[[toc]]
[[div class="legend"]]
|||| Legend ||
[!--
||[[span class="act-marker"]]green diamond with outline[[/span]]|| Active (5+ works in the last 24 months)||
||[[span class="vact-marker"]]green filled diamond[[/span]]|| Very active (15+ works in the last 24 months)||
--]
||[[span class="large-marker"]]yellow four-pointed star[[/span]]|| Large canon (60+ articles)||
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="canon-wrapper"]]
[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=aces-and-eights]]
+ [[[aces-and-eights|Aces and Eights]]]
Between the gunslingers, the snakes, and the anomalies, there's a good chance you might die in the old west. But there's also a chance you'll find your fortune. Don't matter much. Just put your money on the table and play the hand you're dealt.

[[div class="snippet"]]
The union has seen fit to give the survivors of the Razing a sum of 50 dollars and the promise of land in the west. I will myself go there to find my fortune or my death. As I enter this new period of my life, I would like to thank you for your patronage. If you are to ever find yourself in Riddle, Wyoming, pass me by without a word. I do not wish to be reminded of this chapter of my life.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[aces-and-eights|Aces and Eights]]]" by [[user Doctor Cimmerian]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=ad-astra]]
+ [[[ad-astra-per-aspera-hub|Ad Astra Per Aspera]]]
Earth is abandoned. The Veil is gone. Humanity is interplanetary. The world is changing and there is only one place left to go: the stars.

[[div class="snippet"]]
To an outside observer, D-type asteroid 86235 Holt looks like an unspectacular dull red blot in the midsts of the ice orbiting through Uranus' ζ ring. But Ji-yeong has a prospector's eye and the knack for resource extraction one would expect from a former Luna Korean ice miner. She can list what you'd find in 86235 Holt — all the frozen water and organic-rich silicates — without batting an eye. Several minutes ago she did just that.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[25-12-2047|25/12/2047]]]" by [[user NatVoltaic]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=aiad]]
+ [[[aiad-homescreen|AIAD]]]
Stories about virtual people making a virtual difference.

[[div class="snippet"]]
Please don't feel that way. I know it's big and scary… I wish you could see the courage that I see in you.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Null-terminating String]]]" by [[user LurkD]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=antarctic-exchange]]
+ [[[antarctic-exchange-hub|The Antarctic Exchange]]]
The Antarctic Exchange is a canon which focuses on the lives and relationships of the researchers from the Third Antarctic Empire during their time at the Foundation.

[[div class="snippet"]]
It was enough that everyone looked and acted so different; still he stood out so much that sometimes the people here would turn away, would whisper to themselves about him, his companions, their tasks, their work. Antarctica. Empire. Emissaries. Secrets. Antarctica. He could both hear and understand them, but he wasn’t sure if he should let them know.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[impression|Impressions]]]" by [[user Zyn]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=apotheosis]]
+ [[[apotheosis-hub|Apotheosis]]]
The discovery of an ancient anomaly upends the balance between the anomalous and the Foundation. As Humanity becomes a race of gods and global order falls, the Foundation and its enemies must decide how much they're willing to sacrifice to achieve their ideals.

[[div class="snippet"]]
Magic has infinite manifestations, sources, and rules, none of which universally apply. Except one. Everything has a cost. Nothing is free. Humanity is ascending, perhaps all the way to godhood. What price will be asked of us for this? What will happen when we can't afford to pay it?

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[A New Age of Magic]]]" by [[user Modern_Erasmus]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=bellerverse]]
+ [[[bellerverse | Bellerverse]]]
Thousands of years after the end of the world, humanity has to deal with the remnants of the SCP Foundation's unfinished work.

[[div class="snippet"]]
If anyone could get you from one city to another, it was him (extra if he'd been outcast by the locals). If you wanted a relic from the old places, he knew where you could buy it, or, if the price was right, he'd fetch you one himself. The waterskin at his side was empty. Water was plentiful in the Waste, and it was one less thing to weigh him down. The real problem was food. Nothing grew in the waste. There were occasional birds and animals crossing the damp sands, but no trees or grasses of any sort.

The Beller knew the Waste well.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[The List Of Wonders]]]" by [[user DrEverettMann]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=broken-masquerade]]
+ [[[Broken Masquerade HUB | Broken Masquerade]]]
What was hidden now is seen.  How will the Foundation survive in a world where secrecy is no longer an option?

[[div class="snippet"]]
"…day five of the rescue effort, and more bodies are being recovered from the ocean. Initial estimates put the death toll in the million range, with increases occurring constantly. The UN released a statement about the recent North Korean Incident, claiming that they believed it was 'an act of nature'. The recent leak of classified documents from the Japanese Diet pointing towards a theft from what is referred to as 'The Foundation' suggests a different story…"

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Joseon]]]" by [[user Arlecchino]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block" style="background: black; background-size: cover; border: 6px ridge #5C64FF; color: #5C64FF; --link-color: #809fff;"]]
[[image cools.png height="150px"]]
[[include :scp-wiki:fragment:activity-marker tag=but-a-dream]]
+ [[[But A Dream]]]
How much longer until the façade of normalcy cracks? How much longer will you keep them hurting? Quit pretending you've figured us out and just fucking **listen to us.**

[[div class="snippet"]]
I know it hurts, but there's a world of people that think we're disgusting out there. They're talking about pieces of us right now. I want them to see. How would they feel if they knew? It looks so familiar out there. Can we make it unfamiliar? Mutation, castration, smooth outlines and bugging eyeballs. I'm very curious.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[SCP-8060]]]" by [[user ratking666]] and [[user Monkeysky]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=the-coldest-war]]
+ [[[the-coldest-war-hub | The Coldest War]]]
As the clash of capitalist and communist spreads, the most covert organization on earth sinks deeper into hiding. But just where will the Foundation go to escape a global war?

[[div class="snippet"]]
My beloved Dorothy,

There is a whole new war here, a new type of war, industrial and implacable. The American war machine has become unrecognizable.

Out in the jungle bear-clawed women hunt the Viet Cong through their own tunnels for hours before emerging. Airborne commandos on interdiction patrols carry weapons which calcify their targets in the blink of an eye. Villages suspected of sheltering the enemy are plastered in napalm that collects itself into a moving mass of fire and waits for survivors to emerge from cover before flaring back into life…

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[They Will Leave Us With a Shaken Earth]]]" by [[user Vezaz]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=competitive-eschatology]]
+ [[[competitive-eschatology-hub | Competitive Eschatology]]]
The end of the world is here. But it's not just one end of the world. It's all of ends of the world happening at once, competing with each other, with the Foundation - and humanity - in the middle.

[[div class="snippet"]]
"What did you do? What is it? What did you unlock?" She could feel something vibrating in the back of her brain. Her eyes kept being drawn to the lock. It looked exactly the same, visually, but it was also incredibly different. "What's Apakht?"

"It's the End," the Harbinger said. The fabric of reality began to unfold before their eyes.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Apakht]]]" by [[user thedeadlymoose]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=cool-war-2]]
+ [[[cool-war-2-hub | Cool War 2: Ruiz From Your Grave]]]
The FitnessGram Pacer Test is a multistage aerobic capacity test that progressively gets more difficult as it continues. The 20 meter pacer test will begin in 30 seconds. Line up at the start. The running speed starts slowly but gets faster each minute after you hear this signal. //bodeboop//. A single lap should be completed every time you hear this sound. //ding//. Remember to run in a straight line and run as long as possible. The second time you fail to complete a lap before the sound, your test is over. The test will begin on the word start. On your mark. Get ready! Start.

[[div class="snippet"]]
"That's what makes the things real. The breakthroughs, the moments, the momentary lapses in madness. Pop the cork and my bottle overfloweth with hatred and motherfucking anger."

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Conservation of Momentum]]]" by [[user Randomini]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block" style="background: linear-gradient(to bottom,#21252E 10%,#2F333C 50%); color: #EDEDED; --link-color: #FF5512; border: solid 1rem var(--link-color); border-inline-width: 1.75rem; clip-path: polygon(0.625rem 0, 3.25rem 1rem, calc(100% - 3.25rem) 1rem, calc(100% - .625rem) 0, calc(100% - 1.3rem) 2.25rem, calc(100% - 1.3rem) calc(50% - .675rem), 100% 50%, calc(100% - 1.3rem) calc(50% + .675rem), calc(100% - 1.3rem) calc(100% - 2.25rem), calc(100% - .625rem) 100%, calc(100% - 3.25rem) calc(100% - 1rem), 3.25rem calc(100% - 1rem), .625rem 100%, 1.3rem calc(100% - 2.25rem), 1.3rem calc(50% + .675rem), 0 50%, 1.3rem calc(50% - .675rem), 1.3rem 2.25rem); margin-inline: -.75rem;"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=daybreak]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/daybreak/daybreaklogo.png height="80px"]]
+ [[[Daybreak]]]
Daybreak is a canon which focuses on the state of the world following the solar singularity, and the efforts of those struggling to survive.

[[div class="snippet"]]
Learn to embrace the darkness, friends. Fear the light.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[shaggydredlocks-proposal|S. D. Locke's Proposal]]]" by [[user S D Locke]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=doctors-of-the-church]]
+ [[[doctors-of-the-church-hub|Doctors of the Church]]]
Six hundred years ago, the world ended. Today, only one group protects the secrets of the ancient world until a time when they can be understood again; the priests of the Holy Foundation.

[[div class="snippet"]]
"Saint Gears, please guide me in my time of need as you guided the Holy Foundation during the Great Breach.
Bequeath unto me the knowledge to discover that which is false.
Grant unto me the ability to separate logic from falsity.
Allow me to grasp but a portion of the knowledge you once had."

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Quid Est Non Scitum]]]" by [[user Jekeled]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=dread&circuses]]
+ [[[Dread-Circuses-Hub | Dread & Circuses]]]
With Herman Fuller gone, the Freaks are running the Circus now. Flaunting the veil of normalcy and somehow always narrowly avoiding the clutches of the Essie P, Geo Sea and Insurgent Sea, The Circus of the Disquieting provides a sanctuary for anomalous humanoids while offering people a glimpse of what lies behind the Masquerade.

[[div class="snippet"]]
Ladies and Gentlemen, children of all ages, Herman Fuller's Circus of the Disquieting is proud to announce our new Master of Ceremonies. She started off as just another runaway, but through sheer talent and determination she's clawed her way up from magician, to Clown, to troupe leader and now to the Ringmaster of the Circus itself! I give you the beautiful, the astonishing, the magical Icky!

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Dread-Circuses-Hub| Dread & Circuses Hub]]]" by [[user DrChandra]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=end-of-death]]
+ [[[End Of Death HUB | End Of Death]]]
Death is the promise that all of the hardships we face will, at some point, come to an end. But what if death did not keep its promise? If the hardships just kept coming? We would have no choice but to persevere through them. Forever.

[[div class="snippet"]]
The presenter was smiling. 'A miracle', she called it. Joyce couldn't manage a smile — the only thing on her mind was the amount of work that lay ahead.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[omega-k|ΩK]]]" by [[user Croquembouche]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=fading-stars]]
+ [[[fading-stars-hub|Fading Stars]]]
As time ticks ever onward, the things you long took for granted about the world are vanishing one by one. It's easy to forget what you never consider, but when it's forgotten you feel its absence. When you forget you lose the things that make the world real. When you forget, you can no longer dream.

[[div class="snippet"]]
Worship keeps a god alive. His joints may creak and his bones may ache, but he was alive as long as someone kept him alive.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[The Squirrel]]]" by [[user OriTiefling]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]


[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block" style="background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom, #8e8e8e, #000000 50%); color: white;"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=forgotten-memories]]
+ [[span style="text-shadow: 1px 1px 1px white;"]] [[[Forgotten Memories Hub|Forgotten Memories]]][[/span]]
Lives, trapped between the margins, tales just waiting to be told. Stories of love, loss, marginalization, memetic horrors, dangerous ideas and more, but... It all comes back to a name.

[[div class="snippet"]]
A story is told on the wind, a celebration of a different time. The story is a breath, living and consuming empty air. Many people tell the story, and it changes, influenced by each mouth that speaks it.

A woman meets nothing. Nothing begs her for a tale. The woman thinks, and obliges. She puts every ounce of will she can into her thoughts. She remembers the story, knows the story, lives the story. She gives the story to nothing.

The woman looks up. The world is empty. There are no other stories. She has the only story left. A prize. She covets it. Hides it. Keeps it to herself.

Years later, the woman tries to tell the story to her children. Nothing comes out.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Don't Let Me Forget]]]" by [[*user Queerious]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]


[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=alchemy-department]]
+ [[[the-alchemy-department-hub|The Foundation Alchemy Department]]]
Alchemy. Deeply misunderstood, and often mocked. Alchemy is responsible for more around us than anyone knows. The Foundation Alchemy Department is well aware of this. Their mission is to contain the threats that most of the Foundation don't even believe exist. Threats from the distant past come back to haunt our present.

[[div class="snippet"]]
"Ruslav's voice rang out like thunder, and he pulled his hands to his sides, his fists clenched. "YOU WILL NOT DISRUPT OUR WORK, TODAY. I PUSH YOU BACK TO WHENCE YOU ARE. BEGONE SCARLET KING!" With a sudden crack of thunder the building energies flowed into the iron circle, grounding harmlessly into the hand-forged iron. The laughter turned to a snarling sound of pain, as the chains around the entity went taut again, pulling it tight. All went quiet, except for Elder Adebayo's chanting."

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Finding Balance]]]" by [[user DrMagnus]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block" style="background: url("https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/canon-hub/f120a.png") no-repeat -175%; background-size: 80%; border: solid 0.4rem #572c11; border-radius: 6px;"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=from-120s-archives]]
+ [[[from-120-s-archives-hub|From 120's Archives]]]
The world is booming with magic and paratechnology like it never had before, and the planet is more than ready for another shift in the paradigm. History doesn't repeat itself, that much is certain, but it sure as hell rhymes; and from the looks of things, the beginning of the next verse is not that far away…

[[div class="snippet"]]
In those days, it was said that there were neither stars nor gods in the heavens, and the Earth had not yet been sundered into the nations of the world. There was only harmony, under the glorious auspices of the Queen at Peace, the Inventor, and the Queen of War, the Undoer.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[A Faerie Tale Of Twin Queens]]]" by [[user LORDXVNV]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=the-gulf]]
+ [[[The Gulf]]]
The Gulf was aflame. This was going to push our little Task Forces to the limit.

[[div class="snippet"]]
Kate’s heart was beating so loud she could hear it. The wind chimes were louder, too. But she wanted to see what the other side — the Everything Under Everything – what it looked like. What Mackenzie saw in her nightly prayers outside. Kate, wide-eyed, nodded.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[I Double E]]]" by [[user Kate McTiriss]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]


[[div class="canon-block" style="background: black url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/theme:memoria/textback.jpg); background-size: 100%; border: 4px ridge #AFA1A0; color: #484646;"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=memoria-adytum]]

[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/theme:memoria/TitleLogo.png height="80px"]]

+ [[[memoria-adytum|In Memoria, Adytum]]]
**Before the ages of iron and steel, there once arose a great and deathless Empire. When it fell, the nations of the worlds trembled and breathed a sigh of relief, for the demon of Flesh had finally been conquered.**

**But it never truly fell. Like a cancer, it only went into remission.**

[[div class="snippet"]]
And this shall be a sign unto you: that when the Thorn of God is held once more in the hands of the Faithful, Ion shall be birthed again upon the world in fire and blood.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[et-ecce|Et Ecce Equus Pallidus]]]" by [[user MalyceGraves]] and [[user Naepic]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]


[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]
[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=insect-hell]]
+ [[[arbh-class-hub|Insect Hell]]]
All it took to destroy the world was one tiny bug and the promise to contain it. They were vastly underestimated. These are the stories - both good and bad - of those part of and affected by that promise.

[[div class="snippet"]]
Yet decades, even centuries of progress can fall in a single moment. On July 5, 2022, a swarm of locusts escaped from a facility buried deep in the Nevadan desert, and the end of the world began.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Apologies and Redemption]]]" by [[user DrMorris]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=Lampeter]]
+ [[[lampeter-hub|Lampeter]]]
In the dark places – a hidden alley, a door in a train station, a patch of unassuming sky – you can find the back roads to infinity, the lines between realities, a transport network that once spanned half the multiverse – and is now dying a long, slow death.


[[div class="snippet"]]
Lampeter - SCP-7005 - this entire endeavour, these centuries of construction, longing, dreaming. Lampeter, those lonely nights of stationmasters in ski lifts, volcanos, stables, wishing wells, whatever else, as they stared up at the sky at stars that once, as children, they had thought promised infinity. All of them, driven by something more than mere flesh and matter.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[SCP-7005]]]" by [[user Tufto]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block" style="color: #f7f7f7;box-sizing: border-box;padding: 1.2rem;border: 1rem solid;border-image: url(http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/theme:dark-dealings/fancybox.png) 600 round;border-image-width: 6;background-color: #000;background-image: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/theme:dark-dealings/nightfall-header-5.png);background-repeat: repeat-x;background-origin: border-box;box-shadow: 0 3px 5px #000, 0 -3px 5px #000, 3px 0 5px #000, -3px 0 5px #000;"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=nightfall]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/nightfall-hub/moon1.png height="80px"]]
+ [[[nightfall-hub|NIGHTFALL]]]
Following the Foundation's failed attempt to assassinate the goddess Yvith, the world is plunged into eternal night. Creatures of the night run rampant and higher beings, once incomprehensible, walk among us. This is the tale of Xerophylla and the eternal night of Yvith.

[[div class="snippet"]]
And then it strikes you. Embracing the night is the only way to survive in this bloody city. Of that you are certain.
Your claws grow into daggers as the constables bang on the door. Hair begins to sprout from your body. A sickening crack echoes in the nearly empty apartment as your bones grow and displace. Your yellowed eyes rest on last night's victim, propped against the door frame. And you know a harsh truth.
Here. Now. And perhaps for all time?
Everyone dies in the dark.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[nightfall-hub|NIGHTFALL Hub]]]" by [[user Doctor Cimmerian]], [[user MoreMuffins]], [[user Neatpicky]], and [[user TheDarkArtist]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=ninth-world]]
+ [[[the-ninth-world-hub | The Ninth World]]]
A new anomalous age is upon us. Nine books scattered throughout time promise to usher in Paradise. Factions fight in the shadows and across the universe for control of these legendary tomes. In times like this we need unlikely heroes, and an underfunded facility in the midwest might just be what we're looking for.

[[div class="snippet"]]
“The Naja sees everything. From the Ravens feasting on the Wolves to the creatures that stalk the night. Many things were lost in the quest for knowledge. To seek out the gods and take everything they had to offer. Nine tomes were made… Or was it ten? Their power may be infinite but even they hunger for more stories.”

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[Revelations of The Author]]]" by [[user SYTYCFanon]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block" style="background: black url(https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/grigori-karpin-s-author-page/No%20return%20canon%20background); background-size: 100%; border: 4px ridge #ffd900; color: #f7f7f7; --link-color: hsl(51, 100%, 50%);"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=no-return]]

+ [[[no-return-hub | No Return]]]
@@ @@
[[image https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/grigori-karpin-s-author-page/TestNoReturn style="width: 80%;"]]

No Return is about life after the tipping point of __[[[SCP-6500]]]: Inevitable__, along two very different causal paths. One where the Foundation maintains its iron grip on the anomalous world, but those in the know are aware SCP-6500 was the SCPF’s fault and another in which the Foundation dissolves, forming Vanguard – a new organization with various groups of interest – to educate the public about the anomalous world.

------

[[div class="snippet"]]
It is condemnation, unforgiving in its totality and unflinching in its march towards oblivion.

To allow for it to continue on its course is to fail in our mission to Protect. To cede to its influence would be to permit it to rob our world of wonder. To stand by would be tantamount to genocide.

And that, that cannot be forgiven.

[[div_ class="source"]]
From "[[[SCP-6500]]]" By [[user S D Locke]], [[user HarryBlank]], [[user Aethris]], [[user Placeholder McD]], [[user Grigori Karpin]], [[user Darkstuff]], and Ihp
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]


[!-- ------------------------------------------------------- --]

[[div class="canon-block" style="background: url("http://scp-sandbox-3.wdfiles.com/local--files/harry-blank-5/Flag.svg"); background-size: 100%;"]]
[[include fragment:activity-marker tag=on-guard-43]]
+ [[[On Guard 43 Hub |On Guard 43]]]
[[div style="height:16px"]]
[[/div]]
[[image http://scp-sandbox-3.wdfiles.com/local--files/harry-blank-5/43Head.png]]

What kind of anomalies does Canada even have? Moose monsters? Sentient leaves? Newfoundland? Oh, we might surprise you. In the true north strange and freezing, myths and memetics and magical muck are just the tip of the iceberg.

[[div class="snippet"]]

[[module css]]
:root {
    --activity-color: #22b322;
    --large-color: #f7b100;
}

#page-title { text-align: center; }

.canon-block.opener {
    font-weight: 550;
    font-size: 1.15em;
    padding-bottom: 0.375rem;
    margin-block: 1.25rem;
    background-color: #f8f8f8;
}

.info-wrapper {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-areas:
        "toc info"
        "toc legend";
    grid-template-columns: 13.5rem 1fr;
    grid-template-rows: auto 1fr;
    gap: .325rem .875rem;
    font-size: .9125em;
    margin-block: .5rem;
}

@media screen and (max-width: 37.5rem) {
.info-wrapper {
    grid-template-areas:
        "info"
        "toc"
        "legend";
    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
}
}

.info {
    grid-area: info;
    padding: 0 .75rem;
}

.info-wrapper > table, 
.info-wrapper > table :is(tbody, tr, td) {
    display: contents;
}
#toc {
    grid-area: toc;
    display: grid;
    grid-template-areas:
        "title act"
        "list list";
    grid-template-columns: 1fr 4.5em;
    grid-template-rows: auto 1fr;
    margin: initial;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    border: none;
    background: transparent;
}

#toc #toc-action-bar {
    grid-area: act;
    border-bottom: solid 0.05rem #ccc;
    padding: 0.5rem 0;
    text-align: end;
}
#toc-list {
    grid-area: list;
    margin: 0;
    counter-reset: toc-index;
}
#toc-list > div {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-columns: 1.5rem 1fr;
    gap: .25rem;
    align-items: baseline;
    margin-left: 0!important;
    margin-block: .45em;
    line-height: 1.15;
}
#toc-list > div:last-child {
    font-style: italic;
}
#toc-list > div:not(:last-child)::before {
    counter-increment: toc-index;
    content: counter(toc-index) ".";
    font-size: .75em;
    text-align: end;
    font-feature-settings: 'case','ss01','ss04','tnum';
}
#toc-list > div > a {
    grid-column: 2/3;
    width: fit-content;
}

#toc .title {
    grid-area: title;
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0.5rem .175rem;
    border-bottom: solid 0.05rem #ccc;
    text-align: start;
}
.legend { grid-area: legend; }
.legend table { width: 100%; margin: 0;}
.legend table tr:first-child {
    border-bottom: solid 0.05rem #ccc;
}
.legend table td {
    border: none;
    padding: .625rem .325rem;
}
.legend table tr:first-child td {
    font-weight: bold;
    padding-inline: .175rem;
}

.act-marker, .vact-marker, .large-marker {
    display: block;
    position: relative;
    margin: auto;
    color: transparent;
    font-size: 0.1rem;
}
.act-marker, .vact-marker {
    height: .625rem; width: .625rem;
    transform: rotate(45deg);
    background-color: var(--activity-color);
}
.act-marker {
    background-color: transparent;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    border: solid 0.175rem var(--activity-color);
}
.large-marker {
    height: 1.175rem; width: 1.175rem;
    background-color: var(--large-color);
    clip-path: polygon(50% 0, 60% 40%, 100% 50%, 60% 60%, 50% 100%, 40% 60%, 0 50%, 40% 40%);
}

/*----------------------------------*/

#page-content hr {
    margin: 1.5rem 0;
    background-color: #ccc;
}

/*----------------------------------*/

.canon-wrapper {
    display: grid;
    gap: 1.25rem;
    margin-block: 1.25rem;
    clear: both;
}

.canon-block {
    --link-color: #b01;
    font-size: 1.05em;
    text-align: center;
    font-weight: bold;
    position: relative;
    padding: 1.125rem 1.675rem;
    background-color: #fff;
    box-shadow: 0 0 .325rem rgb(0 0 0 / 0.25);
}
.canon-block :is(h1,h2) {
    font-size: 1.75em;
    font-weight: bold;
    letter-spacing: initial;
    margin: 0.225em 0 0;
    scroll-margin-block-start: 2.125rem;
}

.canon-block a {
    color: var(--link-color);
}
.canon-block .snippet {
    text-align: initial;
    font-weight: normal;
    font-style: italic;
    font-size: .875em;
    line-height: 1.375;
    border-top: solid 0.05rem currentColor;
}
.canon-block .snippet p { line-height: inherit; }
.canon-block .snippet .source {
    font-size: .85em;
    font-style: initial;
    font-weight: 600;
    text-align: center;
}

.canon-block .list-pages-box { display: contents; }
.canon-block .activity-container {
    display: flex;
    align-items: center;
    gap: .675rem;
    width: 100%;
    padding-inline: .825rem;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    position: absolute;
    top: 1.125rem; left: 0;
    transform: translateY(-50%);
    pointer-events: none;
}

.activity-container :is(span,br) {
    display: none;
    margin: unset;
    pointer-events: auto;
}

.activity-container .large-marker { 
    display: block;
    transform: translateX(-.275rem);
}
.activity-container.not-large-c .large-marker { display: none; }

/*----------------------------------*/

.canon-wrapper.sub {
    grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill,minmax(17.25rem,1fr));
    gap: 0.75rem;
}

.sub .canon-block {
    font-size: 0.825em;
    font-weight: normal;
    padding: 0.5rem 0.675rem;
}
.sub h2 { font-size: 1.5em; }

.sub .canon-block p {
    margin-block: .525em;
}

/*----------------------------------*/

.sywbac {
    background-color: #fff8cd;
    text-align: start;
    font-weight: normal;
    font-size: 1em;
}
.sywbac :is(.collapsible-block-folded, .collapsible-block-unfolded-link) {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: center;
}
[[/module]]
author: TroyL
